results.title: Macintosh Classic
results.brief_description: If you took a computer class in Australia during the early 1990s, chances are you used one of these boxy personal computers. The Macintosh Classic was released in October 1990 and was the first Macintosh computer to sell for less than $1,000 US dollars, making it one of the most affordable computers on the market at the time. It was really just a cheaper version of the Macintosh SE without as many features, which had been released in 1987, and the Macintosh Classic was seen by some as an attempt to squeeze a few more years out of the earlier model. Part of its reduced cost was due to being made in Singapore, instead of America like previous Macintosh computers. Still, the price and stable operating system made it popular in schools, at home and for small business.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Foyer → Entry → FSF-03. MPL exterior

results.title: Machine tools and motions
results.brief_description: On-the-job pictures show how a worker’s strength is taxed by badly located and incorrectly designed controls on machine shop equipment. The following three principles are elaborated: 1. Locate the machine control so that the operator can maintain normal posture and is not required to work within a dangerous area. 2. Design controls so that unnecessary motions are eliminated from the operations cycle. 3. Design the controls so that necessary motions are within the normal work area.

results.title: Macedonia
results.creator_credit: Giorgos Zervoulakos and General Secretariat of Press and Information of Greece
results.brief_description: A history of Greek Macedonia from prehistoric times to the 19th Century. It covers the relationship between Macedonia and early Greece, the life of the greatest of all Macedonians, Alexander the Great, the Ottoman invasion and longterm occupation by the Turks and the 19th Century resistance to the invaders. It also retells the Greek myths and sources of contemporary folk dances in Macedonia.

results.title: Macbeth: the witches [study extract]
results.creator_credit: George Schaefer and Grand Prize Productions
results.brief_description: Act 1: Scene 1 - the witches foretell Macbeth’s future, on the heath, before Macbeth and MacDuff. Scene 111 - Macbeth is seen in the famous soliloquy scene. Stars Maurice Evans (Macbeth), Ian Bannen (Macduff), and Valerie Taylor, Anita Sharp Bolster and April Olrich (The Witches).

results.title: Macbeth: Banquo's ghost [study extract]
results.creator_credit: George Schaefer and Grand Prize Productions
results.brief_description: Macbeth sees Banquo’s ghost at the banquet, after he had caused his murder. This is a study extract of a screen version of Shakespeare’s “Macbeth” set in the highlands of Scotland. Maurice Evans as Macbeth, Judith Anderson as Lady Macbeth and Ralph Richardson as Banquo’s ghost.

results.title: Macbeth by William Shakespeare: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Raoul Sobel, BHE Education, Film Associates and Insight Productions (US)
results.brief_description: An abbreviated version of Macbeth is performed by a talented English company. Brief narrative bridges are used to connect the scenes, forming a comprehensible and dramatic introduction to the play. The adaption preserves the sense of madness and tragedy of the full length drama.

results.title: M Comme Mathieu = M as in Mathieu
results.brief_description:
Mathieu is just out of a convalescing home and resumes life at home with wife Jeanne. His mental health is still unstable and he cannot control his obsession for Muriel, an imaginary woman who looks just like Jeanne.

Credits: Producer, Bob Zagury ; director, Jean-Francois Adam ; writer, Jean-Francois Adam ; photography, Pierre Lhomme ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Sami Frey, Brigitte Fossey, Roland Dubillard, Bulle Ogier, Laurent Mirouze.

results.title: Luz
results.brief_description: 128…129…129…a walk through a wondrous neighbourhood that only a child could imagine. A little girl plays in the street while her mother calls her home, wherever we find it.

results.title: Luxembourg
results.brief_description: Brief travelogue describing Luxembourg, capital of the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg. Shows typical street scenes, the market in the main square - the Place Guillaume, the Palace of the Grand Duchess and nearby Mondorf-les-Bains famous for its spa waters, the Caisse d’Epargne, the famous bridge - the Pont Adolphe.

results.title: Luther Metke at 94
results.creator_credit: Jorge Preloran, Steve Raymen, Richard Hawkins and Ethnographic Film Program
results.brief_description: A portrait of Luther Metke who has lived in this Cascade Mountains of Oregon since 1907. Tells how he was a veteran of the Spanish American War, an early labor organiser, a poet, and a builder, and today serves as a vital and lucid example of the rural ethic in America.
